com.vmware.o11n.sdk.rest.client
Class DefaultVcoSessionFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.vmware.o11n.sdk.rest.client.DefaultVcoSessionFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
VcoSessionFactory
public class DefaultVcoSessionFactory
extends Object
implements VcoSessionFactory

Default implementation of the VcoSessionFactory interface. This class can be customized to allow connection to vCO servers operating with self-signed certificates.

newSsoSession

public static VcoSession newSsoSession(URI vcoUri,
                                       URI ssoUri,
                                       int tokenLifeTime,
                                       String username,
                                       String password)
                                throws IOException
A helper method that creates a session for a given vCO location, a username and a password. Works only if vCO is running in SSO mode. WARNGING this method is not optimal for production use as initial handshake with the STS server can take a while. That's why a single SsoAuthenticator should be created for the application lifetime and reused for creating SsoAuthentication instances.

Parameters:
vcoUri - location of vCO server REST interface
ssoUri - location of STS server
tokenLifeTime - lifetime of the requested tokens
username -
password -
Returns:
Throws:
IOException - if connection to the STS cannot be established
See Also:
SsoAuthenticator

newSession

public VcoSession newSession(Authentication auth)
Creates an authenticated VcoSession using the provided Authentication object. The returned session can fail upon usage if the provided credentials are incorrect.

newHostnameVerifier

protected HostnameVerifier newHostnameVerifier()
Extension point for custom SSL handling. Allows for fine tuning the certificate policy as vCO REST is always accessed over https.

Returns:

newUnsecureSSLContext

protected final SSLContext newUnsecureSSLContext()
                                          throws KeyManagementException,
                                                 NoSuchAlgorithmException
A default implementation that ignore all certificate errors. Useful for development mode but considered risky for production use.

Returns:
Throws:
KeyManagementException
NoSuchAlgorithmException

newUnsecureHostnameVerifier

protected final HostnameVerifier newUnsecureHostnameVerifier()
A default implementation that ignore all hostname-certificate mismatches. Useful for development mode but considered risky for production use.

Returns:
